RUTH.number_counts:
Analysis for RUTH:

Number Counts: 2 (occurs 8 times), 1 (occurs 5 times), 10 (occurs 2 times), 6 (occurs 2 times), 7 (occurs 1 times)

verses_with_numbers.text: Now it came to pass in the days when the judges ruled, that there was a famine in the land. And a certain man of Beth-lehem-judah went to sojourn in the country of Moab, he, and his wife, and his TWO (2) sons.

And the name of the man Elimelech, and the name of his wife Naomi, and the name of his TWO (2) sons Mahlon and Chilion, Ephrathites of Beth-lehem-judah. And they came into the country of Moab, and continued there.
And Elimelech Naomi's husband died; and she was left, and her TWO (2) sons.
And they took them wives of the women of Moab; the name of the ONE (1) Orpah, and the name of the other Ruth: and they dwelled there about TEN (10) years.
And Mahlon and Chilion died also both of them; and the woman was left of her TWO (2) sons and her husband.
Wherefore she went forth out of the place where she was, and her TWO (2) daughters in law with her; and they went on the way to return unto the land of Judah.
And Naomi said unto her TWO (2) daughters in law, Go, return each to her mother's house: the LORD deal kindly with you, as ye have dealt with the dead, and with me.
# So they TWO (2) went until they came to Beth-lehem. And it came to pass, when they were come to Beth-lehem, that all the city was moved about them, and they said, this Naomi?

Then she said, Let me find favour in thy sight, my lord; for that thou hast comforted me, and for that thou hast spoken friendly unto thine handmaid, though I be not like unto ONE (1) of thine handmaidens.

And Naomi said unto her daughter in law, Blessed he of the LORD, who hath not left off his kindness to the living and to the dead. And Naomi said unto her, The man near of kin unto us, ONE (1) of our next kinsmen.
# And she lay at his feet until the morning: and she rose up before ONE (1) could know another. And he said, Let it not be known that a woman came into the floor.
Also he said, Bring the vail that upon thee, and hold it. And when she held it, he measured SIX (6) of barley, and laid on her: and she went into the city.
And she said, These SIX (6) of barley gave he me; for he said to me, Go not empty unto thy mother in law.

Then went Boaz up to the gate, and sat him down there: and, behold, the kinsman of whom Boaz spake came by; unto whom he said, Ho, such a ONE (1) ! turn aside, sit down here. And he turned aside, and sat down.
And he took TEN (10) men of the elders of the city, and said, Sit ye down here. And they sat down.

And all the people that in the gate, and the elders, said, witnesses. The LORD make the woman that is come into thine house like Rachel and like Leah, which TWO (2) did build the house of Israel: and do thou worthily in Ephratah, and be famous in Beth-lehem:
And he shall be unto thee a restorer of life, and a nourisher of thine old age: for thy daughter in law, which loveth thee, which is better to thee than SEVEN (7) sons, hath born him.
